title: Watch Method for Direction Finding (Southern Hemisphere)
brief: Use an analog watch and the sun to determine north-south direction in the southern hemisphere.
steps: Step 1: Hold the watch horizontal and point the 12 o'clock mark toward the sun.
Step 2: Find the midpoint between 12 o'clock and the hour hand.
Step 3: This midpoint indicates the north-south line.
warnings: Method is reversed from northern hemisphere - point 12 o'clock at sun, not hour hand.
Accuracy decreases closer to the equator.
